intro: Eriospermum crispum, commonly known as the curlyhead eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy, often glandular leaves that are typically crinkled or curled, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster, and it produces a distinctive seed head that is covered in fine, bristly hairs. Eriospermum crispum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
